detailsSection:
From this site, you can download the Microsoft Surface Hub Recovery Tool or the Surface Hub Replacement PC drivers. The Surface Hub Recovery Tool helps you re-image your Surface Hub Solid State Drives (SSD) using a Windows 10 desktop device without a need for calling for support or replacing the SSD itself. With this tool, you can reimage an SSD that has an unknown Administrator password, boot errors, was unable to complete a cloud recovery, or for a device that has an older version of the OS. The tool will not fix physically damaged SSDs. This download is meant to be used with the Surface Hub Admin Guide, which contains further details on using the Surface Hub Recovery Tool. The Surface Hub Replacement PC driver set is available for those customers who have chosen to disable the Surface Hub’s internal PC and use an external computer with their 84” or 55” Surface Hub. This download is meant to be used with the Surface Hub Admin Guide, which contains further details on configuring a Surface Hub Replacement PC.
    The "Date Published" represents the last time this page was updated, so the file you are downloading may be older than the actual "Date Published".

installInstructionSection:
To use Surface Hub Recovery Tool:
  1. Read the instructions for configuring your Surface Hub into Replacement PC mode. You’ll need an external PC to act as the host PC. You will also need to remove the SSD from the Surface Hub, or have an SSD provided by Microsoft Support. For instructions on removing the SSD, see Surface Hub SSD Replacement Guide (PDF).
  2. Download and install the Surface Hub Recovery Tool package by clicking the Download button above from the computer you’d like to use as a host PC.
  3. If your browser prompts you to Save or Run the file, click Run to start the installation immediately or click Save to copy the download to your computer for installation at a later time.
  4. On the host PC, when the installer launches, click Yes to allow the program to make changes to your computer.
  5. Follow the instructions on the screen to install the Surface Hub Recovery Tool.
To use Replacement PC Drivers:
  1. Read the instructions for configuring your Surface Hub into Replacement PC mode. You’ll need an external PC to act as the Replacement PC.
  2. Download and install the Surface Hub Replacement PC driver package by clicking the Download button above from the computer you’d like to use as a Replacement PC.
  3. If your browser prompts you to Save or Run the file, click Run to start the installation immediately or click Save to copy the download to your computer for installation at a later time.
  4. On the Replacement PC, when the installer launches, click Yes to allow the program to make changes to your computer.
  5. Follow the instructions on the screen to install the Surface Hub Replacement PC drivers.
  6. After exiting the install application, reboot your computer to take advantage of an array of peripherals in the Hub, including the screen, pen, and touch systems.
